info.description:
A RESTful API service for accessing NOMIS data sets.

All times sent to the API should be sent in local time without the timezone e.g. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.  All times returned in responses will be in Europe / London local time unless otherwise stated.
info.title: HMPPS Prison API Documentation

get.summary: Offender sentence detail (key dates and additional days awarded).
get.description:
Algorithm

  • If there is a confirmed release date, the offender release date is the confirmed release date.
  • If there is no confirmed release date for the offender, the offender release date is either the actual parole date or the home detention curfew actual date.
  • If there is no confirmed release date, actual parole date or home detention curfew actual date for the offender, the release date is the later of the nonDtoReleaseDate or midTermDate value (if either or both are present)

get.summary: Fetch all case notes of a given type since a given date
get.description:
Returns all case notes - consumed by Delius
These are generated by whenever a case note is created or amended for an offender.
*Note:* An alternative call [GET /case_notes/for_delius](#case-notes-feed-fetch-case-notes-direct-get) has been created for performance reasons.
Some case notes are automatically generated by the system in response to an action relating to the offender e.g. An alert being raised or a prison transfer.
The note type only filters at the top note type level not the sub type.
note_type can be presented multiples times in the URL to filter by multiple note types.

parameters.name: createdDate
parameters.description: Only case notes occurring on or after this date and time (ISO 8601 format without timezone e.g. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS) will be considered.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: a list of types and optionally subtypes (joined with +) to search.

500.description: Unrecoverable error occurred whilst processing request.

get.description: Count of case notes

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Only case notes occurring on or after this date (in YYYY-MM-DD format) will be considered.  If not defined then the numMonth before the current date, unless a toDate is defined when it will be numMonths before toDate

parameters.name: numMonths
parameters.description: Number of month to look forward (if fromDate only defined), or back (if toDate only defined). Default is 1 month

parameters.name: staffId
parameters.description: a list of staffId numbers to use.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: Only case notes occurring on or before this date (in YYYY-MM-DD format) will be considered. If not defined then the current date will be used, unless a fromDate is defined when it will be numMonths after fromDate

500.description: Unrecoverable error occurred whilst processing request.

**from** and **to** query params are optional.

If **both** are absent, scope will be limited to 24 hours starting from midnight yesterday.
If **to** is present but **from** is absent, **from** will be defaulted to 24 hours before **to**.

get.summary: List of offenders matching specified criteria.
get.description: List of offenders matching specified criteria.

parameters.name: Page-Limit
parameters.description: Requested limit to number of prisoner records returned.

parameters.name: Page-Offset
parameters.description: Requested offset of first record in returned collection of prisoner records.

parameters.name: Sort-Fields
parameters.description: Comma separated list of one or more of the following fields - offenderNo, pncNumber, croNumber, firstName, lastName, dob

parameters.name: Sort-Order
parameters.description: Sort order (ASC or DESC) - defaults to ASC.

parameters.name: anyMatch
parameters.description: If true, offenders that match any of the specified criteria will be returned. The default search behaviour is to only return offenders that match all of the specified criteria. If the prioritisedMatch parameter is also set true, this parameter will only impact the behaviour of searching using offender name and date of birth criteria.

parameters.name: croNumber
parameters.description: The offender's CRO (Criminal Records Office) number.

parameters.name: dob
parameters.description: The offender's date of birth. Cannot be used in conjunction with dobFrom or dobTo. Must be specified using YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: dobFrom
parameters.description: Start date for offender date of birth search. If dobTo is not specified, an implicit dobTo value of dobFrom + 10 years will be applied. If dobTo is specified, it will be adjusted, if necessary, to ensure it is not more than 10 years after dobFrom. Cannot be used in conjunction with dob. Must be specified using YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: dobTo
parameters.description: End date for offender date of birth search. If dobFrom is not specified, an implicit dobFrom value of dobTo - 10 years will be applied. Cannot be used in conjunction with dob. Must be specified using YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: The first name of the offender.

parameters.name: gender
parameters.description: Offender's gender code (F - Female, M - Male, NK - Not Known or NS - Not Specified).

parameters.name: includeAliases
parameters.description: If true the result set should include a row for every matched alias.  If the request includes some combination of firstName, lastName and dateOfBirth then this will be a subset of the OFFENDERS records for one or more offenders. Otherwise it will be every OFFENDERS record for each match on the other search criteria. Default is false.

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: The last name of the offender.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Offender's location filter (IN, OUT or ALL) - defaults to ALL.

parameters.name: middleNames
parameters.description: The middle name(s) of the offender.

parameters.name: offenderNo
parameters.description: List of offender NOMS numbers. NOMS numbers have the format:ANNNNAA

parameters.name: partialNameMatch
parameters.description: If true, the search will use partial, start-of-name matching of offender names (where provided). For example, if lastName criteria of 'AD' is specified, this will match an offender whose last name is 'ADAMS' but not an offender whose last name is 'HADAD'. This will typically increase the number of matching offenders found. This parameter can be used with any other search processing parameter (e.g. prioritisedMatch or anyMatch).

parameters.name: pncNumber
parameters.description: The offender's PNC (Police National Computer) number.

parameters.name: prioritisedMatch
parameters.description:
If true, search criteria prioritisation is used and searching/matching will stop as soon as one or more matching offenders are found. The criteria priority is:

1. offenderNo
2. pncNumber
3. croNumber
4. firstName, lastName, dob
5. dobFrom, dobTo

As an example of how this works, if this parameter is set true and an offenderNo is specified and an offender having this offender number is found, searching will stop and that offender will be returned immediately. If no offender matching the specified offenderNo is found, the search will be repeated using the next priority criteria (pncNumber) and so on. Note that offender name and date of birth criteria have the same priority and will be used together to search for matching offenders.

500.description: Unrecoverable error occurred whilst processing request.

Returns all active alerts for the specified offender or those that meet the optional criteria. Active alerts are listed first, followed by inactive alerts, both sorted by ascending order of alert date.
  • if alert_type is specified then only alerts of that type are returned
  • if modified_since is specified then only those alerts created or modified on or after the specified date time. The following formats are supported: 2018-01-10, 2018-01-10 03:34, 2018-01-10 03:34:12, 2018-01-10 03:34:12.123
  • If include_inactive=true is specified then inactive alerts are also returned.

post.summary: Record transaction at previous Prison.
post.description:
Post a financial transaction to Nomis to a prison that the offender is no longer at.

The valid prison_id and type combinations are defined in the Nomis transaction_operations table which is maintained by the Maintain Transaction Operations screen (OCMTROPS), from the Financials Maintenance menu. Only those prisons (Caseloads) and Transaction types associated with the NOMISAPI module are valid. Only Transaction types with a usage of R (Receipt) are valid.Transaction Types are maintained via the Maintain Transaction Types screen (OCMTRANS).

Transaction is posted to the specified prison. if the account has been closed at this prison then it is re-opened first.

If the offender has been transferred to another prison then the funds are transferred to this prison.

If the account was previously closed then it will be closed again.

If the offender has been released then the funds are transferred to NACRO. Based on the Nomis Clear Inactive accounts screen (OTDCLINA).

parameters.name: X-Client-Name
parameters.description: If present then the value is prepended to the client_unique_ref separated by a dash. When this API is invoked via the Nomis gateway this will already have been created by the gateway.

400.description:
One of:
  • Invalid transaction type - The transaction type has not been set up for the API for {prison_id}
  • Finance Exception - This indicates an unexpected financial problem, check the nomis_api_log table for details.
  • Only receipt transaction types allowed - Only transaction types with a transaction usage of Receipt are allowed.
  • Sum of sub account balances not equal to current balance - The sum of all the sub account balances does equal the current balance held for the trust account
  • Offender being transferred - The offender is currently in transit
  • Offender still in specified prison - The offender is still at the specified prison. Use Record Transaction instead.

404.description:
One of:
  • Offender Not Found - No offender matching the specified offender_id has been found on nomis.
  • Offender never at prison - The offender has never been at the specified prison

409.description: Duplicate Post - A transaction already exists with the client_unique_ref provided.

500.description: Unrecoverable error occurred whilst processing request.

400.description: Not a digital prison.  Prison not found.

500.description: Unrecoverable error occurred whilst processing request.

post.summary: Store a payment for an offender account.
post.description:
Pay events will be stored in a table on receipt by Nomis to be processed by a batch job scheduled to run after the last Nomis payroll batch job but before the advances and scheduled payments batch jobs.
Possible payment types are:
A_EARNCredit, Offender Payroll
ADJDebit, Adjudication Award

Example request:
{ "type": "A_EARN", "description": "May earnings", "amount": 1, "client_transaction_id": "PAY-05-19" }
The valid prison_id and type combinations are defined in the Nomis transaction_operations table which is maintained by the Maintain Transaction Operations screen (OCMTROPS), from the Financials Maintenance menu. Only those prisons (Caseloads) and Transaction types associated with the NOMISAPI module are valid.
This will be setup by script intially as part of the deployment process as shown below

400.description:
One of:
  • Offender not in specified prison - prisoner identified by {noms_id} is not in prison {prison_id}
  • Invalid payment type
  • Client reference more than 12 characters
  • Missing data in request
  • Exception - An unexpected error has occurred. Details will have been logged in the nomis_api_logs table on the Nomis database.

404.description: Requested prison or offender could not be found.

409.description: Duplicate post - after an error with a post this response will be given for subsequent duplicate attempts

500.description: Unrecoverable error occurred whilst processing request.

post.summary: Post a financial transaction to NOMIS.
post.description:
The valid prison_id and type combinations are defined in the Nomis transaction_operations table which is maintained by the Maintain Transaction Operations screen (OCMTROPS), from the Financials Maintenance menu. Only those prisons (Caseloads) and Transaction types associated with the NOMISAPI module are valid.
This will be setup by script intially as part of the deployment process as shown below

Transaction TypeDescriptionDigital PrisonNon Digital Prison
CANTCanteen SpendYesNo
REFNDCanteen RefundYesNo
PHONEPhone CreditYesNo
MRPRMisc Receipt - Private CashYesYes
MTDSMoney through digital serviceYesYes
DTDSDisbursement through Digital serviceYesYes
CASHDCash DisbursementYesYes
RELAMoney to RelativesYesYes
RELSMoney to Relatives- SpendsYesYes
Notes:
  • The sub_account the amount is debited or credited from will be determined by the transaction_type definition in NOMIS.
  • If the field X-Client-Name is present in the request header then the value is prepended to the client_unique_ref separated by a dash. When this API is invoked via the Nomis gateway this will already have been created by the gateway.
  • The client_unique_ref can have a maximum of 64 characters, only alphabetic, numeric, ‘-’ and ‘_’ characters are allowed

parameters.name: X-Client-Name
parameters.description: If present then the value is prepended to the client_unique_ref separated by a dash. When this API is invoked via the Nomis gateway this will already have been created by the gateway.

400.description:
One of:
  • Insufficient Funds - The prisoner has insufficient funds in the required account to cover the cost of the debit transaction
  • Offender not in specified prison - prisoner identified by {noms_id} is not in prison {prison_id}
  • Invalid transaction type - The transaction type has not been set up for the API for {prison_id}
  • Finance Exception - An unexpected error has occurred. Details will have been logged in the nomis_api_logs table on the Nomis database.

409.description: Duplicate post - The unique_client_ref has been used before

dob.description: The offender's date of birth. Cannot be used in conjunction with dobFrom or dobTo. Must be specified using YYYY-MM-DD format.

dobFrom.description: Start date for offender date of birth search. If dobTo is not specified, an implicit dobTo value of dobFrom + 10 years will be applied. If dobTo is specified, it will be adjusted, if necessary, to ensure it is not more than 10 years after dobFrom. Cannot be used in conjunction with dob. Must be specified using YYYY-MM-DD format.

dobTo.description: End date for offender date of birth search. If dobFrom is not specified, an implicit dobFrom value of dobTo - 10 years will be applied. Cannot be used in conjunction with dob. Must be specified using YYYY-MM-DD format.

maxYearsRange.description: Max Date Range, applied to dobFrom or dobTo, default is 10, max allowed is 10

includeAliases.description: If true the result set should include a row for every matched alias.  If the request includes some combination of firstName, lastName and dateOfBirth then this will be a subset of the OFFENDERS records for one or more offenders. Otherwise it will be every OFFENDERS record for each match on the other search criteria. Default is false.

partialNameMatch.description: If true, the search will use partial, start-of-name matching of offender names (where provided). For example, if lastName criteria of 'AD' is specified, this will match an offender whose last name is 'ADAMS' but not an offender whose last name is 'HADAD'. This will typically increase the number of matching offenders found. This parameter can be used with any other search processing parameter (e.g. prioritisedMatch or anyMatch).

anyMatch.description: If true, offenders that match any of the specified criteria will be returned. The default search behaviour is to only return offenders that match all of the specified criteria. If the prioritisedMatch parameter is also set true, this parameter will only impact the behaviour of searching using offender name and date of birth criteria.

prioritisedMatch.description:
If true, search criteria prioritisation is used and searching/matching will stop as soon as one or more matching offenders are found. The criteria priority is:

1. offenderNo
2. pncNumber
3. croNumber
4. firstName, lastName, dob
5. dobFrom, dobTo

As an example of how this works, if this parameter is set true and an offenderNo is specified and an offender having this offender number is found, searching will stop and that offender will be returned immediately. If no offender matching the specified offenderNo is found, the search will be repeated using the next priority criteria (pncNumber) and so on. Note that offender name and date of birth criteria have the same priority and will be used together to search for matching offenders.

bookingBeginDate.description: Date Prisoner booking was initial made

admissionDate.description: Date of admission into this prison

releaseDate.description:
Confirmed, actual, approved, provisional or calculated release date for offender, according to offender release date algorithm.

Algorithm

  • If there is a confirmed release date, the offender release date is the confirmed release date.
  • If there is no confirmed release date for the offender, the offender release date is either the actual parole date or the home detention curfew actual date.
  • If there is no confirmed release date, actual parole date or home detention curfew actual date for the offender, the release date is the later of the nonDtoReleaseDate or midTermDate value (if either or both are present)

releaseDate.description:
Confirmed, actual, approved, provisional or calculated release date for offender, according to offender release date algorithm.

Algorithm

  • If there is a confirmed release date, the offender release date is the confirmed release date.
  • If there is no confirmed release date for the offender, the offender release date is either the actual parole date or the home detention curfew actual date.
  • If there is no confirmed release date, actual parole date or home detention curfew actual date for the offender, the release date is the later of the nonDtoReleaseDate or midTermDate value (if either or both are present)

nonDtoReleaseDateType.description: Indicates which type of non-DTO release date is the effective release date. One of 'ARD', 'CRD', 'NPD' or 'PRRD'.

nonDtoReleaseDate.description: Release date for non-DTO sentence (if applicable). This will be based on one of ARD, CRD, NPD or PRRD.
